text: Hi all trying to style a pop-up form how can I do this? Been going in circles from Google searches. Since the form is loaded in an iFrame.
Hi Matt, have you turned of the HubSpot Default Styling?
If you turn it off, it should fall back to the Form Styling provided by your theme
<@UBT0AHWLD> so I should set it to raw html?
I did that, but maybe it’s still cached…
are you using the developer extension? you can bust the cache via option
Ya I am and also updating the stylesheet to force clearing. Updated the default form settings too not showing up. So seems like not busting.
<@UBT0AHWLD> I see the issue looks like it’s actually a CTA and within that it’s forcing us to pick a form style…
Anyways thanks for your help I’ll keep going down the rabbit hole I think default should work here as a setting.

Hi everyone! I'm trying to create a breadcrumbs module and one of the features we need to have is dynamically change the row based on the table field (is that even possible?)

we're implementing it like this because there are some cases where we will be fetching the text from a different table.

Any insights are appreciated :pray:  thank you!
